Extending rpathsonpaths

Martin Hinsch

2017-12-05

This vignette gives a quick introduction into the internal structure of the source code as well as some pointers to documentation that might be helpful for anyone intending to work on the package.


Internal structure

rpathsonpaths follows the usual structure for R packages that includes compilable code: R code sits in ./R, C/C++ sources can be found below ./src.

The R code mostly consists of shallow convenience functions. The majority of rpathsonpath’s functionality is implemented in C++ using Rcpp to interface with R.

The C++ source code can broadly classified into three different chunks:

  • network library Most of the network and simulation functionality is implemented as a separate, heavily templated library that is entirely independent of R. The code is situated under ./src/libpathsonpaths. The library is also available as a standalone C++ project on github.

  • R functions All C++ functions that make up rpathsonpath’s R API are declared in ./src/dir_network.h and implemented in ./src/dir_network.cc.

  • utilities Supporting functionality that is either too specific to warrant inclusion in libpathsonpaths or dependent in some way on R or Rcpp is implemented in various files under ./src.

Documentation

Most of the code should be sufficiently commented to (hopefully) be understandable without too much effort. If you find this not to be the case please feel free to submit a corresponding issue on rpathsonpaths github page.

libpathonpath’s API as well as all other internal classes and functions should be (briefly) documented in Doxygen format. To create the documentation in html format run make cdocs in rpathsonpaths root directory. Again, missing documentation is considered a bug and should be submitted as such on github.
